==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|こう|もう|yomi=o}}
Possibly coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こうもう}}-derived elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=こうもう|紅|tr1=kō|t1=red, crimson|毛|tr2=mō|t2=hair}}.

Alternately, possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こうもう}} compound {{m|ltc|紅毛|tr=*hung *mɑu}}.

Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} simplified {{m|zh|红毛}} and traditional {{m|zh|紅毛|tr=hóngmáo}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|こ|うもう}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ko̞ːmo̞ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうもう}}

# [[red]] [[hair]]
# during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], an [[epithet]] for the [[Dutch]], contrasting with the term {{m|ja|南蛮|tr=nanban|lit=Southern barbarians}} used for the [[Spanish]] and [[Portuguese]]
# in modern times, an [[epithet]] for [[Westerner]]s or [[European]]s

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|red hair}} {{ja-l|赤毛|あかげ|akage}} {{qualifier|more general term for a [[redhead]]}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|紅毛画|こうもうが|kōmōga}}: during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], western pictures that were imported into Japan through Dutch-controlled Nagasaki; those Japanese-produced pictures that were influenced by western artwork
* {{ja-l|紅毛人|こうもうじん|kōmōjin}}: during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], an [[epithet]] for a [[Dutch]] person, contrasting with the term {{m|ja|南蛮|tr=nanban|lit=Southern barbarians}} used for the [[Spanish]] and [[Portuguese]]
* {{ja-l|紅毛船|こうもうせん|kōmōsen}}: an [[epithet]] for European trading ships that visited Japan in the late 1600s, primarily from the [[Netherlands]], contrasting with the term {{m|ja|南蛮船|tr=nanbansen|lit=Southern barbarian ship}} used for ships from [[Spain]] and [[Portugal]]
* {{ja-l|紅毛碧眼|こうもうへきがん|kōmō hekigan}}: literally “red hair, blue eyes” → a [[Westerner]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=おらんだ}}
By extension from the ''red hair'' meaning being applied to the [[Dutch]], used as [[jukujikun]] for {{m|ja|オランダ|tr=Oranda||Holland}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|慣用読み|Kan'yōyomi}}
* {{ja-pron|おらんだ}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|おらんだ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=おらんだ|obsolete}} [[Holland]], the [[Netherlands]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading was used primarily during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], and has since fallen out of use.
